hero.title: Aleppo Competitive
hero.subtitle: Join the premier competitive programming competition and challenge yourself alongside the brightest minds in problem-solving and algorithmic thinking.

about.title: About ACPC
about.subtitle: The Aleppo Collegiate Programming Contest (ACPC) is the first stage of the International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC). It aims to develop algorithmic thinking and problem-solving skills among Aleppo University students.
about.introduction: ACPC aims to highlight the International Collegiate Programming Contest as the most important global event in competitive programming and shed light on its academic and research benefits for Aleppo University. ICPC focuses on developing algorithmic thinking and problem-solving skills, giving students experience in competing under time pressure and teamwork, which positively reflects on the university's reputation and motivates students to excel.

teamBased.title: Team-Based
teamBased.description: Compete in teams of exactly 3 members under the supervision of one coach, fostering collaboration, role division, and communication skills.

challenging.title: Challenging Problems
challenging.description: Tackle 8-15 high-level algorithmic problems in 5 hours, designed to test your problem-solving and algorithmic thinking abilities.

prizes.title: Prizes & Recognition
prizes.description: Win medals (gold, silver, bronze) and cash prizes, and gain opportunities for training and employment at leading global companies like IBM, Huawei, and JetBrains.

history.title: History and Overview of ICPC
history.subtitle: A global journey that began in 1977 and expanded to include over 3,000 universities from 100 countries

beginning.title: The Beginning (1977)
beginning.description: ICPC was officially launched in 1977 at Texas A&M University in the United States, where a limited number of students gathered to compete in solving algorithmic problems within a specified time frame.

expansion.title: Global Expansion
expansion.description: In the late 1980s, it expanded to North America, then crossed continental borders to include Europe, Asia, Africa, and Latin America. By the mid-1990s, it had become the largest global platform for challenging computer science students.

worldFinals.title: World Finals
worldFinals.description: The first true world finals were held in 1997 in Salzburg, Austria, with 17 teams participating, while today the number approaches 100 teams from different continents around the world.

modernEra.title: Modern Era (2017 - Present)
modernEra.description: Acquired by the ICPC Foundation in 2017. Over 3,000 universities from about 100 countries participate annually, supported by major sponsors such as IBM, Huawei, and JetBrains.

format.title: Competition Structure
format.worldFinalists: About 100 teams of the best programmers meet in the world finals
format.awards: Distribution of medals (gold, silver, bronze), certificates of appreciation, and cash prizes

achievements.title: Aleppo University Achievements in ICPC
achievements.subtitle: A distinguished history in regional and international programming competitions
achievements.introduction: Aleppo University has a distinguished history in programming competitions, reflecting its prominent position as one of the leading higher education institutions in Syria and the region.

2016.title: Gold Medal and Qualification to Thailand
2016.description: Aleppo University team won a gold medal at the Arab and African level and qualified to participate in the World Finals held in Thailand.

2018.title: Regional Silver Medal
2018.description: The team won a silver medal in the regional qualifiers at the Arab and African level.

2019.title: Participation in Portugal
2019.description: The university team participated in the World Finals held in Portugal, confirming continued presence in global competitions.

2021.title: Bronze and Qualification to Bangladesh
2021.description: The team won a regional bronze medal, along with participation in the World Finals held in Bangladesh.

2023.title: Bronze and Qualification to Egypt
2023.description: The team continued its excellence by winning a bronze medal in the regional qualifiers and qualified to participate in the World Finals held in Egypt.

2024.title: Syrian Champion and Runner-up
2024.description: Aleppo University was crowned champion and runner-up of the programming competition in Syria, an achievement that crowns a long journey of excellence and creativity.

achievements.summary: These achievements demonstrate Aleppo University's commitment to developing students' scientific and practical capabilities, and its active role in preparing a generation capable of innovation and competing at the highest levels.

goals.title: Competition Goals and Outcomes
goals.subtitle: Comprehensive development of academic and practical skills

technical.title: Technical Skills
technical.algorithms: Refine skills in algorithm analysis and data structures
technical.problemSolving: Develop the ability to solve complex problems
technical.efficiency: Drive academic research toward innovating more efficient solutions

soft.title: Soft Skills
soft.teamwork: Enhance teamwork and effective task division
soft.pressure: Develop the ability to work under severe time pressure
soft.competition: Foster a spirit of positive competition among students

career.title: Career Opportunities
career.industry: Connect students with the job market and global technology companies
career.training: Provide training and employment opportunities at leading companies
career.experience: Enrich students' practical experience and link it to global standards

university.title: University Benefits
university.ranking: Raise the university's international academic ranking
university.talent: Attract talented students and provide them with academic incentives
university.collaboration: Enhance research collaboration between departments and algorithm workshops
university.partnerships: Build partnerships with technology companies to sponsor teams

competition.title: Competition Format
competition.subtitle: Understanding how the competition works and what to expect.

rules.title: Contest Rules
rules.languages: Standard programming languages supported (C++, Java, Python)
rules.system: PC² system for submitting and evaluating solutions

eligibility.title: Who Can Participate?
eligibility.university: Any student enrolled at Aleppo University (undergraduate and graduate)
eligibility.free: Free participation at local and national levels
eligibility.allLevels: Open to all skill levels from beginners to professionals
eligibility.teamwork: Ability to work in a team under time pressure

structure.title: Competition Structure
structure.subtitle: Four stages from local to global

university.title: Stage 1: University Level
university.name: Aleppo Collegiate Programming Contest (ACPC)
university.description: Any student enrolled at Aleppo University can participate. Top teams qualify for the national competition.
university.qualification: Number of qualifying teams determined by total number of participants

national.title: Stage 2: National Level
national.name: Syrian Collegiate Programming Contest (SCPC)
national.description: Qualifying teams from different Syrian universities participate. A different university hosts this competition each year.
national.qualification: A number of teams qualify for the regional competition

regional.title: Stage 3: Regional Level
regional.name: Africa & Arab Collegiate Programming Contest (ACPC)
regional.description: A highly prestigious competition where elite Arab and African programmers compete. Syria has a strong presence in this competition.
regional.participants: Elite teams from Arab and African countries
regional.qualification: Limited number of teams qualify for the world finals

world.title: Stage 4: World Level
world.name: International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC)
world.description: The world's most popular programming competition, gathering the best teams from all regions. Attracts global software companies offering job opportunities.
world.participants: About 100 teams of the world's best programmers
world.location: Held in a different country each season
world.costs: Airfare and visa costs only (accommodation and transport provided by competition management)

organization.title: Competition Organization
organization.subtitle: Two days of precisely organized events

practiceDay.title: Practice Competition Day
practiceDay.registration: Team registration and receiving competition t-shirts
practiceDay.technical: Technical session explaining the PC² software system
practiceDay.practice: Practice competition for 2-3 hours to test equipment and system

competitionDay.title: Official Competition Day
competitionDay.balloon: Balloon attached when a problem is solved correctly
competitionDay.firstSolve: Photos taken of teams solving problems for the first time
competitionDay.scoreboard: Results displayed during first 4 hours only
competitionDay.freeze: Results frozen in the last hour
competitionDay.ceremony: Closing ceremony to honor winners and announce qualifiers

teams.title: Organizing Teams
teams.organizing: Organizing team: Overall supervision and coordination with sponsors and university administration
teams.logistics: Logistics team: Coordination and supervision of venue and physical equipment
teams.media: Media team: Promoting the competition and sponsoring companies
teams.technical: Technical team: Setting up computers and other technical requirements
teams.volunteers: Volunteer team: Assisting in organization and meeting participants' needs
teams.judges: Judges team: Preparing problems and answering queries (from other universities)
teams.note: All these teams rely primarily on university students

funding.title: Competition Funding
funding.subtitle: Joint support from university and private sector

university.title: Host University
university.description: The host university contributes to funding events and infrastructure

sponsors.title: Sponsors and Supporters
sponsors.description: Many Syrian companies support the programming competition to provide job opportunities for outstanding students and promote their companies.
sponsors.list: Syriatel, MTN, Tradinos, Al Baraka Bank, Sanad Youth Development Foundation

participation.title: Participation Costs
participation.local: Free at university and national levels
participation.world: Airfare and visa only (accommodation and transport provided)

schedule.title: Event Schedule
schedule.subtitle: Plan your day with our detailed competition timeline.

contact.subtitle: Have questions? We're here to help!
